author: agemanning
content:
Hey all. Is anyone using gossipsub 1.1 in testnets? Wondering about how it performs and/or scoring settings. In particular, I'm wondering about how a peer that is syncing gets scored. 
A syncing peer shouldn't propagate any attestations and/or blocks because it cannot verify them. It will then look like a censoring peer and I think gossipsub will negative score such a peer. I guess potentially we need to be careful with when to subscribe to channels and/or adjust the scoring parameters. Anyone had a look into this yet?

author: arnetheduck
content: that's an interesting observation - we're juggling this for the purpose of our own nbc-level peer scoring as well

author: arnetheduck
content: we're considering something like delayed scoring, but it's a bit awkward - ie when queueing up orphans, if they fail to apply when the parent comes around we can score the peer accordingly

author: arnetheduck
content: not subscribing while syncing is a bit awkward as well - ideally one would subscribe as a listening-only peer and not forward blocks in this period, because from a distributed synchronization point-of-view, subscribe-then-sync plugs all the race conditions that otherwise happen

author: nishant0
content:
yeah its a bit tricky there, a syncing peer could easily be penalised due to a low `Mesh Message Delivery Rate` , and eventually removed from the mesh. There would probably need to be a way to signal to other peers
in the mesh that you are 'syncing' , so that the new peer is not booted out before it can get fully synced.
